00006 package WeBWorK::PG::IO;
00007 use base qw(Exporter);
00008 
00009 =head1 NAME
00010 
00011 WeBWorK::PG::IO - Private functions used by WeBWorK::PG::Translator for file IO.
00012 
00013 =cut
00014 
00015 use strict;
00016 use warnings;
00017 
00018 BEGIN {
00019     our @EXPORT = qw(
00020         includePGtext
00021         read_whole_problem_file
00022         read_whole_file
00023         convertPath
00024         getDirDelim
00025         fileFromPath
00026         directoryFromPath
00027         createFile
00028         createDirectory
00029     );
00030 
00031     our %SHARE = map { $_ => __PACKAGE__ } @EXPORT;
00032     
00033     if (defined $main::VERSION) {
00034         my $mod;
00035         for ($main::VERSION) {
00036             /^1\./          and $mod = "WeBWorK::PG::IO::WW1";
00037             /^2\./          and $mod = "WeBWorK::PG::IO::WW2";
00038             /^Daemon\s*2\./ and $mod = "WeBWorK::PG::IO::Daemon2";
00039         }
00040         
00041         eval "package Main; require $mod; import $mod"; # this is runtime_use
00042         die $@ if $@;
00043     } else {
00044         warn "\$main::VERSION not defined -- not loading version-specific IO functions";
00045     }
00046 }
00047 
00048 =head1 SYNOPSIS
00049 
00050  BEGIN { $main::VERSION = "2.0" }
00051  use WeBWorK::PG::IO;
00052  my %functions_to_share = %WeBWorK::PG::IO::SHARE;
00053 
00054 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00055 
00056 This module defines several functions to be shared with a safe compartment by
00057 the PG translator. It also loads a version-specific module (if found) based on
00058 the value of the C<$main::VERSION> variable.
00059 
00060 This module also maintains a hash C<%WeBWorK::PG::IO::SHARE>. The keys of this
00061 hash are the names of functions, and the values are the name of the package that
00062 contains the function.
00063 
00064 =head1 FUNCTIONS
00065 
00066 =over
00067 
00068 =item includePGtext($string_ref, $envir_ref)
00069 
00070 Calls C<createPGtext> recursively with the $safeCompartment variable set to 0 so
00071 that the rendering continues in the current safe compartment.  The output is the
00072 same as the output from createPGtext. This is used in processing some of the
00073 sample CAPA files.
00074 
00075 =cut
00076 
00077 sub includePGtext  {
00078     my $evalString = shift;
00079     if (ref($evalString) eq 'SCALAR') {
00080         $evalString = $$evalString;
00081     }
00082     $evalString =~ s/\nBEGIN_TEXT/\nTEXT\(EV3\(<<'END_TEXT'\)\);/g;
00083     $evalString =~ s/\\/\\\\/g; # \ can't be used for escapes because of TeX conflict
00084     $evalString =~ s/~~/\\/g;   # use ~~ as escape instead, use # for comments
00085     no strict;
00086     eval("package main; $evalString") ;
00087     my $errors = $@;
00088     die eval(q! "ERROR in included file:\n$main::envir{probFileName}\n $errors\n$evalString"!) if $errors;
00089     use strict;
00090     return "";
00091 }
00092 
00093 =item read_whole_problem_file($filePath)
00094 
00095 Don't use for huge files. The file name will have .pg appended to it if it
00096 doesn't already end in .pg.  Files may become double spaced.?  Check the join
00097 below. This is used in importing additional .pg files as is done in the sample
00098 problems translated from CAPA. Returns a reference to a string containing the
00099 contents of the file.
00100 
00101 =cut
00102 
00103 sub read_whole_problem_file {
00104     my $filePath = shift;
00105     $filePath =~s/^\s*//; # get rid of initial spaces
00106     $filePath =~s/\s*$//; # get rid of final spaces
00107     $filePath = "$filePath.pg" unless $filePath =~ /\.pg$/;
00108     read_whole_file($filePath);
00109 }
00110 
00111 sub read_whole_file {
00112     my $filePath = shift;
00113     local (*INPUT);
00114     open(INPUT, "<$filePath") || die "$0: read_whole_file subroutine: <BR>Can't read file $filePath";
00115     local($/)=undef;
00116     my $string = <INPUT>;  # can't append spaces because this causes trouble with <<'EOF'   \nEOF construction
00117     close(INPUT);
00118     \$string;
00119 }
00120 
00121 =item convertPath($path)
00122 
00123 Currently a no-op. Returns $path unmodified.
00124 
00125 =cut
00126 
00127 sub convertPath {
00128     return wantarray ? @_ : shift;
00129 }
00130 
00131 sub getDirDelim {
00132     return ("/");
00133 }
00134 
00135 =item fileFromPath($path)
00136 
00137 Uses C<&getDirDelim> to determine the path delimiter.  Returns the last segment
00138 of the path (i.e. the text after the last delimiter).
00139 
00140 =cut
00141 
00142 sub fileFromPath {
00143     my $path = shift;
00144     my $delim = &getDirDelim();
00145     $path = convertPath($path);
00146     $path =~ m|([^$delim]+)$|;
00147     $1;
00148 }
00149 
00150 =item directoryFromPath($path)
00151 
00152 Uses C<&getDirDelim> to determine the path delimiter.  Returns the initial
00153 segments of the of the path (i.e. the text up to the last delimiter).
00154 
00155 =cut
00156    
00157 sub directoryFromPath {
00158     my $path = shift;
00159     my $delim = &getDirDelim();
00160     $path = convertPath($path);
00161     $path =~ s|[^$delim]*$||;
00162     $path;
00163 }
00164 
00165 =item createFile($fileName, $permission, $numgid)
00166 
00167 Creates a file with the given name, permission bits, and group ID.
00168 
00169 =cut
00170 
00171 sub createFile {
00172     my ($fileName, $permission, $numgid) = @_;
00173     open(TEMPCREATEFILE, ">$fileName")
00174         or die "Can't open $fileName: $!";
00175     my @stat = stat TEMPCREATEFILE;
00176     close(TEMPCREATEFILE);
00177     
00178     # if the owner of the file is running this script (e.g. when the file is
00179     # first created) set the permissions and group correctly
00180     if ($< == $stat[4]) {
00181         my $tmp = chmod($permission, $fileName)
00182             or warn "Can't do chmod($permission, $fileName): $!";
00183         chown(-1, $numgid, $fileName)
00184             or warn "Can't do chown($numgid, $fileName): $!";
00185     }
00186 }
00187 
00188 =item createDirectory($dirName, $permission, $numgid)
00189 
00190 Creates a directory with the given name, permission bits, and group ID.
00191 
00192 =cut
00193 
00194 sub createDirectory {
00195     my ($dirName, $permission, $numgid) = @_;
00196     $permission = (defined($permission)) ? $permission : '0770';
00197     # FIXME -- find out where the permission is supposed to be defined
00198     my $errors = '';
00199     mkdir($dirName, $permission)
00200         or $errors .= "Can't do mkdir($dirName, $permission): $!\n".caller(3);
00201     chmod($permission, $dirName)
00202         or $errors .= "Can't do chmod($permission, $dirName): $!\n".caller(3);
00203     unless ($numgid == -1) {
00204         chown(-1,$numgid,$dirName)
00205             or $errors .= "Can't do chown(-1,$numgid,$dirName): $!\n".caller(3);
00206     }
00207     if ($errors) {
00208         warn $errors;
00209         return 0;
00210     } else {
00211         return 1;
00212     }
00213 }
00214 
00215 =back
